name: Radios
description:
In the Help Room, there is a radio underneath the red flag. Knife or shoot the radio, and it will start playing music from the Zombies mode.

[*Black Ops III* only] In the Starting Room, in the corner in front of the HELP door, there is a radio on the ground. Interact with it to hear a recording from Dr. Monty on Nacht Der Untoten.
footer: Nacht der Untoten  >  Radios

name: Samantha Dolls Musical Easter Egg - *Samantha's Lullaby*
description:
[*Black Ops III* only] There are 4 buttons around the map that can be pressed by interacting with them, at which you hear a button press sound. The four buttons are located as follows:

> On the top of the wall/pillar to the left of the Mule Kick machine.

> Under the shelf at the bottom of the steps in the Help room

> On the ceiling above the stairwell in the starting room.

> On the wall opposite to the Argus on the second floor.

 After activating all 4 buttons, a thunderous sound should play.
footer: Nacht der Untoten  >  Samantha's Lullaby  >  Step 1

name: Samantha Dolls Musical Easter Egg - *Samantha's Lullaby*
description: After activating all 4 buttons and hearing the sound, a Samantha doll appears on the ground in front of the RK5 wall buy. Interact with it to start the search for Samantha dolls.
footer: Nacht der Untoten  >  Samantha's Lullaby  >  Step 2

name: Samantha Dolls Musical Easter Egg - *Samantha's Lullaby*
description:
Follow the musical sound to locate the Samantha doll playing the music. Find and shoot the Samantha dolls around the map until the music brings you back to the original Samantha doll on the ground in front of the RK5. The Samantha dolls appear in the following locations:

> In the hole in the roof to the left of the Der Wunderfizz machine

> On a fence post in the farthest window in the Starting Room

> On the pond in the left window barrier of the Starting Room

> On the end of the tanks barrel in the window next to Mule Kick

> On the top floor, on top of a power line post

> On top of a truck in the farthest right Starting Room window

> Next to a power generator on the top floor looking through a window

> In the hole in the ceiling on the bottom floor
footer: Nacht der Untoten  >  Samantha's Lullaby  >  Step 3

name: Samantha Dolls Musical Easter Egg - *Samantha's Lullaby*
description: Return to the original Samantha doll, now propped up and twirling, and interact with it again. The Samantha doll will be raised by a skeleton hand, sink into the ground, and the song *Samantha's Lullaby* will start playing, along with a Max Ammo appearing.
footer: Nacht der Untoten  >  Samantha's Lullaby  >  Step 4

name: Musical Easter Egg - *Undone*
description: The musical easter egg *Undone* by Kevin Sherwood can be activated, in *Black Ops* and in *Black Ops III*, by shooting explosive barrels outside the building, visible from the barriers. How the musical easter egg is activated is dependent on the game.
footer: Nacht der Untoten  >  Undone

name: Musical Easter Egg - *Undone*
description:
In *Black Ops*, there are three specific explosive barrels, each seen from a different window barrier in the Starting room, that are the only ones required to be shot to activate the musical easter egg. Going clockwise around the room, the barrels are located:

> 1. At the window with stairs and the lake, closest to the stairs.

> 2. At the window with mostly trees, one of the two barrels farthest in the background.

> 3. At the window with the vehicle on the right, hidden in the fog near the wheels of the truck in the background.
footer: Nacht der Untoten  >  Undone  >  Black Ops

name: Musical Easter Egg - *Undone*
description:
In *Black Ops III*, all 28 explosive barrels around the map must be shot to activate the musical easter egg. For a barrel to be counted, it must blow up, which happens eventually after being shot, or from further shooting it.

Starting at the first window in the Starting room visible upon starting, there are 4 explosive barrels visible:
footer: Nacht der Untoten  >  Undone  >  Black Ops III

name: Musical Easter Egg - *Undone*
description: Next window counterclockwise in the Starting room, there are 3 more explosive barrels visible.
footer: Nacht der Untoten  >  Undone  >  Black Ops III

name: Musical Easter Egg - *Undone*
description: Next window counterclockwise in the Starting room, there are 2 more explosive barrels visible, one of which is a bit harder to see due to being farther in the background and the fog.
footer: Nacht der Untoten  >  Undone  >  Black Ops III

name: Musical Easter Egg - *Undone*
description: Next window counterclockwise in the Starting room, there are 5 more explosive barrels visible, two of which are hard to distinguish as two separate barrels due to being farther in the background and having an object in the way.
footer: Nacht der Untoten  >  Undone  >  Black Ops III

name: Musical Easter Egg - *Undone*
description: Next window counterclockwise in the Starting room, there are 6 more explosive barrels visible.
footer: Nacht der Untoten  >  Undone  >  Black Ops III

name: Musical Easter Egg - *Undone*
description: In the Help room, at the sole barrier at the end of the length of the room, there are 4 more explosive barrels visible.
footer: Nacht der Untoten  >  Undone  >  Black Ops III

name: Musical Easter Egg - *Undone*
description: In the Upstairs room, there are two windows on the wall with the Argus wall-buy. There is 1 explosive barrel visible from the leftmost window...
footer: Nacht der Untoten  >  Undone  >  Black Ops III

name: Musical Easter Egg - *Undone*
description: ... and 2 more explosive barrels visible from the rightmost window to the side
footer: Nacht der Untoten  >  Undone  >  Black Ops III

name: Musical Easter Egg - *Undone*
description: Heading to the area above the Starting room at the top of the spiral stairs, looking out to where the first couple of barrels were, there is 1 last explosive barrel only visible from the second floor.
footer: Nacht der Untoten  >  Undone  >  Black Ops III

name: Turning on the power
description: The power switch to turn on the power in Verrückt is at the room at the opposite side of the map from the spawn location. Turning on the power will make all the perk-a-cola machines and electrical traps usable.
footer: Verrückt  >  Power

name: Radios
description:
On the American/right side (right from spawn), on the balcony upstairs, there is a barrier on the left side of the balcony, through which a radio is sitting on a desk. Shoot the radio, and it will start playing different music from the Zombies mode (somewhat quietly, since it plays as a sound effect, rather than map music).

[*Black Ops III* only] On the German/left side, in the small room at the bottom-right of the stairwell, there is a radio underneath the desk. Interact with it to hear a recording from Dr. Monty on Verrückt.
footer: Verrückt  >  Radios

name: Fountain Statue Easter Egg
description: Looking at the fountain with blood in the middle of the asylum, seen through the windows, dealing enough damage into the fountain, such as detonating a grenade in the fountain, will cause the statue of the fountain to spew blood out of the statue's mouth.
footer: Verrückt  >  Fountain Statue Easter Egg

name: Musical Easter Egg - *Lullaby for a Dead Man*
description: The musical easter egg *Lullaby for a Dead Man*, by Kevin Sherwood and Elena Siegman, can be activated by going to the second floor on the German/left side (left from spawn), where there is a room with the toilets. Flush the left toilet 3 times in a row to start the musical easter egg.
footer: Verrückt  >  Lullaby for a Dead Man

name: Samantha Dolls Musical Easter Egg - *Samantha's Sorrow*
description:
[*Black Ops III* only] Go to the second floor on the German/left side (left from spawn), where there is a room with the toilets. Staring from in front of them at them:

> 1. Flush the rightmost toilet 9 times
> 2. Flush the middle toilet 3 times
> 3. Flush the leftmost one 5 times.

After doing this, a thunderous sound should play.
footer: Verrückt  >  Samantha's Lullaby  >  Step 1

name: Samantha Dolls Musical Easter Egg - *Samantha's Sorrow*
description: After interacting with the toilets and hearing the sound, a Samantha doll appears on the ground next to the Der Wunderfizz machine. Interact with it to start the search for Samantha dolls.
footer: Verrückt  >  Samantha's Lullaby  >  Step 2

name: Samantha Dolls Musical Easter Egg - *Samantha's Sorrow*
description:
Follow the musical sound to locate the Samantha doll playing the music. Find and shoot the Samantha dolls around the map until the music brings you back to the original Samantha doll on the ground in front of the Der Wunderfizz machine. The Samantha dolls appear in the following locations:

> On the balcony visible from the left window behind Speed Cola.

> In the rightmost toilet in the toilets room on the left side before the power room.

> On a morgue body tray in the medical room near spawn.

> On top of the manequin next to the box location on the top of the stairs on the German/left side.

> In a pot in the kitchen between the power room and the Speed Cola room.

> On the dentist/patient chair near the spawn location.

> On the ceiling, looking through an barrier on the wall in the Mule Kick room.

> In the room above Mule Kick, in the flaming ceiling hole.

> On the top of the fountain statue in the middle of the map.
footer: Verrückt  >  Samantha's Lullaby  >  Step 3

name: Samantha Dolls Musical Easter Egg - *Samantha's Sorrow*
description: Return to the original Samantha doll, now propped up and twirling, and interact with it again. The Samantha doll will be raised by a skeleton hand, sink into the ground, and the song *Samantha's Sorrow* will start playing, along with a Max Ammo appearing.
footer: Verrückt  >  Samantha's Lullaby  >  Step 4
